bioghist.p: Charles Willard Heckel (1913-1988) was Moderator of the General Assembly from 1972 to 1973. He received a BA from Dartmouth, an MA from Columbia University and Bachelor of Laws from Rutgers University. During World War II he served 4 1/2 years in the U.S. Navy, completing his duty as a legal officer with the Seventh Fleet in Shanghai, China. After the war, he became a member of the faculty of Rutgers Law School, serving as a dean (1963-1970) and professor of law (1946-1983). He also lectured at Princeton Theological Seminary and was Moderator of the Newark Presbytery and a member of its General Council and various committees. In 1968 he was elected Moderator of the Synod of New Jersey and then re-elected the following year.

scopecontent.p: These are the papers of Heckel from his term as Moderator of the General Assembly, 1972-1973. Materials include correspondence, policy statements, task force reports, minutes of the General Assembly, travel and meeting agendas, and several issues of the General Assembly Daily News. Topics of policy statements include privacy, amnesty for Vietnam war resisters, and state and local tax reform. The collection also includes a background paper on Legal Aid and the availability of legal services, from 1973.
